intro: Stackhousia brunonis var. annua, commonly known as the annual stackhousia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. This annual herb typically grows to a height of about 30 cm, with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats.
